body:
The `intel` package uses the `parallel_studio` suite tarball as the source. The `intel` package is supposed to just install the compiler components. While there is a known issue with IMPI always getting installed, the 19.0.5 version actually installs the entire suite.

```console
$ ls /opt/ssoft/apps/linux-centos7-sandybridge/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.5-dmf674k5egb2afrjkbkqn2jfrhvr5dfh/
bin                                 daal                include       lib       parallel_studio_xe_2019
compilers_and_libraries             debugger_2019       intel         Licenses  parallel_studio_xe_2019.5.075
compilers_and_libraries_2019        documentation_2019  intelpython2  man       pstl
compilers_and_libraries_2019.5.281  ide_support_2019    intelpython3  mkl       samples_2019
conda_channel                       impi                ipp           mpirt     tbb
...
```
That includes everything, daal, mkl, mpi, even python. Compare that to the previous 19.0.4 version.
```console
$ ls /opt/ssoft/apps/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/intel-19.0.4-dwajv2aftwcbwo4z6ywm2wlavz6a2cb4/
bin                                 conda_channel       include   man                            pstl
compilers_and_libraries             documentation_2019  intel     mpirt                          samples_2019
compilers_and_libraries_2019        ide_support_2019    lib       parallel_studio_xe_2019        tbb
compilers_and_libraries_2019.4.243  impi                Licenses  parallel_studio_xe_2019.4.070
...
```
I have not looked very deeply to see what might be happening but I suspect that the Intel installer has changed in some way. This also affect the environment module, with the non-compiler components getting set in the module.
